resource.description: The Http-Proxy Addon allows you to configure your web application to get around the Same Origin Policy restriction (e.g. cross-domain). You can use it to install new servlet proxies (http-proxy add), list them (http-proxy list), remove those not needed (http-proxy remove) and eventually remove all proxies with a single command (http-proxy cleanAll).

Addons that adds Content Negotiating View Resolver configuration to your application context: MVC multiple representations By default the addon is configured to resolve the HTML(JSP), XML and JSON representations. It favors path extension (e.g. .xml, .json ..) over AcceptHeader?(s). This configuration is JAXB2 centric!

Addons that adds Content Negotiating View Resolver configuration to your application context: MVC multiple representations By default the addon is configured to resolve the HTML(JSP), XML and JSON representations. It favors path extension (e.g. .xml, .json ..) over AcceptHeader?(s). This configuration is JAXB2 centric!

Addons that adds Content Negotiating View Resolver configuration to your application context: MVC multiple representations By default the addon is configured to resolve the HTML(JSP), XML and JSON representations. It favors path extension (e.g. .xml, .json ..) over AcceptHeader?(s). This configuration is JAXB2 centric!

JAXB2 Schema complier addon. It adds the maven-jaxb2-plugin to your pom.xml. The plugin participates in the generate-code phase and produces code of the schema-derived classes out of the XML Schemas, DTDs and so on.

The Executable WAR Addon configures the Maven project to makes it possible to create web applications that can be run from the command line (java -jar your-application.war) or deployed in a container. When run from the command line the executable-war starts an embedded Jetty webserver that in turn hosts the webapp contained in the war.

resource.presentationname: Spring Roo - Http-Proxy To Allow Cross-Domain Access
resource.description: The Http-Proxy Addon allows you to configure your web application to get around the Same Origin Policy restriction (e.g. cross-domain). You can use it to install new servlet proxies (http-proxy add), list them (http-proxy list), remove those not needed (http-proxy remove) and eventually remove all proxies with a single command (http-proxy cleanAll).

p.v: Spring Roo - Http-Proxy To Allow Cross-Domain Access

resource.description: The Executable WAR Addon configures the Maven project to makes it possible to create web applications that can be run from the command line (java -jar your-application.war) or deployed in a container. When run from the command line the executable-war starts an embedded Jetty webserver that in turn hosts the webapp contained in the war.

When run from the command line the executable-war starts an embedded Jetty webserver that in turn hosts the webapp contained in the war.

When run from the command line the executable-war starts an embedded Jetty webserver that in turn hosts the webapp contained in the war.
